benchmark_details.name: RouterEval
benchmark_details.overview: RouterEval is a benchmark tailored for router research, which includes over 200,000,000 performance records for 12 popular LLM evaluations across various areas such as common-sense reasoning, semantic understanding, etc., based on over 8,500 various LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic framework to assess router effectiveness and enable comprehensive evaluation of routing methods in large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Deployment challenges arise due to the large number of LLMs required for optimal performance.

data.source: Performance records collected from over 8,500 LLMs across various benchmarks.

methodology.calculation: Performance calculated based on the selection vector created by the router and evaluation against reference models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher performance metrics indicate better routing effectiveness.
methodology.baseline_results: Details of each router's performance metrics provided under varying conditions in the tables of the paper.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through analysis of multiple router candidate groups.
